title: Days, Months, and Seasons
reading_greek:
DAYS (Feminine)
- Δευτέρα (Monday)
- Τρίτη (Tuesday)
- Τετάρτη (Wednesday)
- Πέμπτη (Thursday)
- Παρασκευή (Friday)
- Σάββατο (Saturday - Neut)
- Κυριακή (Sunday)

SEASONS (Masculine)
- Χειμώνας (Winter)
- Άνοιξη (Spring - Fem)
- Καλοκαίρι (Summer - Neut)
- Φθινόπωρο (Autumn - Neut)

THE MONTHS (Oi Mines)
- Ιανουάριος, Φεβρουάριος... Αύγουστος. (January, February... August.)
- Σεπτέμβριος, Οκτώβριος... Δεκέμβριος. (September, October... December.)
reading_english:
**Reference**: [(See Page 125)](/assets/grammar.pdf#page=125)

VOCABULARY: CALENDAR

1. ON MONDAY: Use Accusative.
   - 'Tin Deftera' (On Monday).
   - 'To Savvato' (On Saturday).

2. IN SUMMER: Use Accusative.
   - 'To Kalokairi' (In summer).

3. THE GREETINGS:
   - Kalo Mina (Good Month - 1st of month).
   - Kalo Savvatokyriako (Good Weekend).
audio_script:
Let's plan our week. 

Days of the week are mostly Feminine.
Deftera (2nd day), Triti (3rd day), Tetarti (4th), Pempti (5th).
Paraskevi (Preparation day).
Savvato (Sabbath - Neuter).
Kyriaki (Lord's Day).

To say 'On Monday', we use the Accusative 'Tin'. 
'Tha se do tin Deftera' (I will see you on Monday).
